description: doc: clarify that gccgo is a GCC front-end

messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go

I don't see what's wrong with the current text.

-rob

On 2012/08/01 01:51:27, r wrote:
> I don't see what's wrong with the current text.
> 
> -rob

Hello, it is a small change I understand. But if you are selectively reading the faq with no prior knowledge that gccgo is a GCC frontend. Then it can be read as gccgo is C++ front-end, which is technically not accurate.

On Wed, Aug 1, 2012 at 1:14 AM,  <Mike.Rosset@gmail.com> wrote:
>
> Hello, it is a small change I understand. But if you are selectively
> reading the faq with no prior knowledge that gccgo is a GCC frontend.
> Then it can be read as gccgo is C++ front-end, which is technically not
> accurate.

How about "Gccgo has a front-end written in C++, with a recursive
descent parser, coupled...."

Ian

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com, r@golang.org, iant@google.com (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

Please take another look.

On 2012/08/01 13:25:45, iant2 wrote:
> On Wed, Aug 1, 2012 at 1:14 AM,  <mailto:Mike.Rosset@gmail.com> wrote:
> >
> > Hello, it is a small change I understand. But if you are selectively
> > reading the faq with no prior knowledge that gccgo is a GCC frontend.
> > Then it can be read as gccgo is C++ front-end, which is technically not
> > accurate.
> 
> How about "Gccgo has a front-end written in C++, with a recursive
> descent parser, coupled...."
> 
> Ian

ah good suggestion thanks.

LGTM with change but wait for r http://codereview.appspot.com/6454072/diff/7001/doc/go_faq.html File doc/go_faq.html (right): http://codereview.appspot.com/6454072/diff/7001/doc/go_faq.html#newcode1347 doc/go_faq.html:1347: Gccgo has a front-end written in C++, with a recursive descent parser coupled to the s/parser coupled/parser, coupled/

LGTM although i would s/front-end/front end/ since it's a noun phrase.

sorry for the delay

*** Submitted as https://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=f3ca7d5b1b0b ***
